Hi Ken, 

I am currently a C/C++ programmer in a very small company here in=
 
Bulgaria. I don't take a lot of money there, but I like my current 
job b=
ecause I have enough free time for working on my own stuff :)
I'm a hobbyis=
t in programming since the age of 10. My interest on AI 
is significant. I =
don't make money with this whole thing, it is just 
the passion.. you know =
:) 

When I first learned about NEAT, I already had done many experiments 
=
with NNs, (never GAs). But, as I realized what in fact is NEAT, I 
started =
to love it, seriosly. I've read every paper you put out in 
the Internet (a=
nd many times), even the PowerPoint slides from your 
website. :)

So, what=
 I wanted to say is, during the last year, I did a lot of 
NEAT research on=
 my own, like "can it do this? can it do that?".. 
That were days that I wa=
s only thinking of some new stuff to put NEAT 
evolving NNs into :)

I was =
tweaking the code a lot, too.. Damn, I know every piece of it.. 
It's just =
that I'm lazy so I didn't write my own version of NEAT but 
use your releas=
e :)

The last papers, explaining the concept of CPPNs, opened my 
imaginat=
ion even more. I was even planing to make some Alife 
applications involvin=
g CPPNs, but the papers for HyperNEAT were 
released, so I decided to repla=
ce NEAT with HyperNEAT on most of my 
projects, to see what happens :) I lo=
ve experimenting with this 
stuff. It is in fact taking me away from work s=
ometimes, my boss 
tells me "Check out and fix this code", but I run an evo=
lution 
instead :D

I implemented HyperNEAT for a couple of hours, I didn't=
 write it from 
scratch, but added it to the existing NEAT code I am curren=
tly 
maintaining.

I am happy to know that this had impressed you :) It was=
 not a lot of 
work, really :) There is so much more to do ;)
And let me te=
ll you that I am.. like a fan. :) I am losing patience 
to see your next pa=
per and future directions of research :) And I 
will keep you and the whole=
 community informed about everything new 
and/or cool, that I manage to dis=
cover and/or adopt in 
applications :) 

Cheers, 
Peter
